## Is the rent is too damn high in Colorado?

Let's analyze data from the [data.coloardo.gov](https://data.colorado.gov/) [Rent database](https://data.colorado.gov/Housing/Rents-by-Type-of-Apartment-in-Colorado/cmr9-ue2w)
and find some afforable places to rent around Colorado.

## Rent Changes Over Time
How have rents changed between `r min(coloradoRent$year)` and 
`r max(coloradoRent$year)`?

`r rentIncrease$apartmenttype[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)]`
apartments in
`r rentIncrease$subregion[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)]` saw
the largest increase in rent between `r min(coloradoRent$year)` and 
`r max(coloradoRent$year)`. During this 
`r sum(max(coloradoRent$year) - min(coloradoRent$year))` year period, rent rose
`r max(rentIncrease$delta)`% from `r paste("$", round(min(coloradoRent$averagerent[coloradoRent$apartmenttype == rentIncrease$apartmenttype[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)] & coloradoRent$subregion == rentIncrease$subregion[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)]]),2), sep = "")` to `r paste("$", round(max(coloradoRent$averagerent[coloradoRent$apartmenttype == rentIncrease$apartmenttype[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)]  & coloradoRent$subregion == rentIncrease$subregion[rentIncrease$delta == max(rentIncrease$delta)]]),2), sep = "")`.
